featured.text: Some parents try to get rid of half of the candy after their children go to bed, but dentists say parents also need to separate the good kinds of treats from the bad.
Dr. Sax, a proponent of single-sex education, points out that keeping boys and girls separate in the classroom has yielded striking educational, social, and interpersonal benefits.
The baby panda Yuan Zai at the Taipei Zoo was separated from her mother because of a minor injury that occurred during her birth.
This dietary need has led to a constant battle to keep the deer separate from the unforgiving nature of tons of onrushing rolling stock.
In this method of printing, individual letters were made from separate pieces of metal.

definition.zh_def: 使分開或隔離的行為或過程。
definition.en_def: To set or keep apart; to divide into distinct parts.
definition.example: Please separate the recyclable materials from the trash.
